Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Throughout \Through*out"\, adv. In every part; as, the cloth was of a piece throughout. [1913 Webster] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Throughout \Through*out"\, prep. Quite through; from one extremity to the other of; also, every part of; as, to search throughout the house. [1913 Webster]
Nor to their idle orbs doth sight appear Of sun, or moon, or star, throughout the year. --Milton. [1913 Webster] [1913 Webster]
throughout adv 1: from first to last; "the play was excellent end-to-end" [syn: {end-to-end}] 2: used to refer to cited works [syn: {passim}]
